text: I'm 35 with bipolar disorder. My daily meds: 600mg pregabalin 1000mg sodium valproate 20mg aripiprazole Taking all of these every day pretty much wipes me out, but I lead a good, stable life now. Love and best wishes to anyone struggling.

text: Yes, exactly. That's what's most interesting about aripiprazole, with its high affinity but partial agonism, meaning at full saturation one ought to get the sweetspot of 60-80% occupancy in the mesolimbic but not the total blockade in NS and TI, plus some MC tickling DLPFC.

metadata.raw_text: Yes, exactly. That's what's most interesting about aripiprazole, with its high affinity but partial agonism, meaning at full saturation one ought to get the sweetspot of 60-80% occupancy in the mesolimbic but not the total blockade in NS and TI, plus some MC tickling DLPFC.

metadata.raw_text: Yep, part of that dense talk :). Hope you're well! I'm actually now reading on aripiprazole in schizophrenia, after my talk @EricJNestler said that in adults it acts as an antagonist.. (I think in adolescents it is an agonist). antagonist-there's not much evidence even in adults!

text: Pictured below is me with my antipsychotic (aripiprazole, aka Abilify). Many people take antipsychotics as a way to boost their antidepressant. I take it for that reason, and because I experience delusions (and some rare hallucinations) that separate me from reality #MentalHealth

text: Just to note, though: Without my meds, this UGH would have been me screaming and crying and threatening to walk out, and not realising it was my MH until well after the fact. For me, aripiprazole is a relationship saver. #KeepTalkingMH

text: My mom has tremors generated by Aripiprazole. She has schizophrenia and live in Venezuela with me. She needs a change of medication, but here is impossible to get it. We are looking for some extraordinary help of outside. This country is hell.
